comment.body: **starts at 1:03:43, ends 1:26:00**, mentions developer challenges like GFW block, amazon tor meek proxies, alot of files vs slow storage devices.

@P2P: it does not mean anything, some people say SSD. I think it is not possible to change username without loosing ability to be notified when someone mention my old username because of my older content.
it can be good feature for a ZeroLSTN, though it should have compatible format with ZeroLSTN so admin can integrate it.

**Ronja** seems to be made for 1km distance data transmitting only https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RONJA (and probably hard working in bad conditions like rain, fog), do not see it to be sold anywhere.

Koruza seems to be expensive: http://www.koruza.net/order/
Though there probably ar other devices that can create intranet kind of network.

Devices for that low distances can be good for local groups of people, not sure if there are cheap (order price and electricity consumption) devices for distances like hundreds of kilometers.
Hello Contact95
Open Office [should open docx](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=open+office+docx)
In my case simple docx was opened and those that was damaged, what about trying to convert them to .odt which is open office supported document? https://duckduckgo.com/?q=docx+to+odt+convert

I do not use MS Office so i can not tell if it open .odt (search engine would probably tell), but it opens .doc (same as open office), maybe some online converter (as i linked) would be able to properly convert formating of the document so you can edit it in Open office and save it as a .doc format supported by MS Office.

Currently one can add custom peers to any URL ([see here](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:133:Changelog:+July+18,+2018)) and also there is a [/Config](/Config page) where one can add custom trackers and if other peers use these, the peers should interconnect thanks to these trackers. [Anyone can setup a torrent tracker](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1534255624_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Anyone+found+good+tutorial+on+how+to+setup+public+torrent+tracker).

@leftside: [here](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#serverinfo) it seems to be described (may be outdated, do not know):
"fileserver_port": 15441, # FileServer port
"ui_port": 43110, # UiServer port (Web)
PS: 4300 was an custom port example i think
Unsure which one to use, if one works or if works even without port, please leave a feedback. Maybe worth trying to use ping or netcat before so one verify LAN computers see each other on OS level.
**\#NSFW**

it shows 7 peers. but is not playing there. Address seems to be: http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroLSTN.bit/merged-ZeroLSTN2/1HLqL1eSZTRMpKLXjprjy7hFftuoAZEz1u/data/users/15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ/sido_-_liebe-1533309991626.mp3
Are you sure the file really exist on that address and has same name?
Firefox shows bad MIME type error, but maybe it shows it because it is unable to get the file, not because it would have bad format/file type.

when i open ZeroNet/log/debug.log and add cursor to the end of the file and search (from botom to the top) a few first characters of the site where the file is located (1HLqL1eSZTRMpKLXjprjy7hFftuoAZEz1u) - 1HLq
then i find lines:
[2018-08-14 12:09:41,967] DEBUG    WorkerManager:**1HLq**L1..Ez1u 17*.59.33.*:0: Verify failed: data/users/15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ/sido_-_liebe-1533309991626.mp3.piecemap.msgpack, error: Download failed, failed peers: 22, workers: 2
[2018-08-14 12:09:43,068] DEBUG    WorkerManager:**1HLq**L1..Ez1u 17*.59.33.*:0: No task found, stopping

Do you have .piecemap file also there? What means "Verify failed" ? What about trying to sign the data/users/15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ/content.json from within 1HLqL1eSZTRMpKLXjprjy7hFftuoAZEz1u site (0) menu?

@leftside: a good questions, have you been able to connect some peer with or without port numbers? (http://127.0.0.1:43110/siteaddress/?zeronet_peer=192.168.0.9:43110,192.168.0.8:4300) which port number worked (ui port or fileserver?) the file server port is maybe randomly defined on first ZN start, then it can be changed in [/Config](/Config) - restart ZN required after change i assume. The port in the address is defining where the destination computer is listening for new zeronet connections. I think it is the fileserver port in case when defining peers to be used when opening zeronet element/site.

that is interesting, because i am using ZeroMe for some time and do not remember any such content.json error there. Would be curious to see the screenshot, or some exact description, copy paste full error and even better to copy paste appropriate lines from ZeroNet/log/debug.log

Yes, i wish the [Search function is in ZeroMe](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/issues/98), ZeroTalk, ZeroBlog. It [already is in ZeroUp](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroUp/commit/fa8624530379ac99e3e04319d8310f6428cce257) though. In the meantime one have to use [ZeroHello](/) and into the "Search in connected sites" add example:
Quantumworld site:zerome
(btw. i think such search may not search everything, but only hubs i connected thanks to following users on that hubs. i alas not yet remembered when zerome downloads new hubs for me, based on which actions beside following user from that hub - i may be all wrong about how this works)

Tickling board on Millchan: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1EvWEgpVuMdbKTJR5vWZTV9LP1hBjMfyMd:tkl:0
@It's a test!: 👍

@Julia: the advantages are described for example [in the leading post where the Millchan Engine is introduced](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:1b5f282e-6a57-4aa4-ae11-8b85dda51509). For me i think discussion boards (hub sites) does not relly on single person (merger site owner) so they are more independent. Also people can easily and automatically seed newly added content (images) that was added to the hubs/discussion boards. And hub owners can set own limits on submitted content and user quota. etc. Disadvantage is currently that @mcdev not yet created option to create new hub by a button click and also you have to first visit the hub before you can see its content via merger site (Millchan Engine) which is quite big disadvantage (that the hub site is not loaded automatically).

To find boards on Millchan engine, someone would have to advertise their hub zite address somewhere (either in private or public). Here you can find couple of hubs publicly:
1. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E/?/category/merger-zite
2. search for: mill
👍
Millchan Engine hubs are way less often used than classic Millchan currently as the ME is very new and zeronet has low amount of people.

SUMMARY: **Austria online forums operators with 100K+ users would be required (The plan calls for the law to go into force in 2020) to verify that their users provide valid full name possibly by requiring phone authentication. Since the beginning of the year, all SIM cards in Austria have had to be registered with a photo ID.** .. yes we are heading to the point where government|corporations knows everything about us. Important for zeronet is to maintain its users identity anonymous.

All these demands on internet site operators like content filtering, anti-terorist 1 hour takedown, identity verification can cause small forums to rather close and big platforms to stay = more centralization of "power", easier/faster for the things to go wrong.
Maybe cause is an unsupported file type / extension? Maybe trying to move not allowed file out of the site directories and trying again.

important reminder! i think it is good to utilize several identities, one for sensitive stuff one for less sensitive. I am using multiuser_local setting in my zeronet.conf and that allow me to switch identity on the top of the ZeroHello page. PS: for good anonymity, use "tor: always" mode on ZeroHello i bet.

yes some distributions also not worked for me perfectly, for example one was unable to install from a USB, was complaining it can not find CD. Other not supported my hardware (old kernel). and many distributions has small usability issues that one need to duck.com and fix. Also i was having issues in regards to computer suspension where network or mouse speed had problem after unsuspend. I have not tried many distributions and not found any where developers would quickly react to fix usability issues and really want to follow up your bug report.
i see, but it is completely white

unsure what dump you mean, i may help to seed something, i am sure i would not be alone.

btw. i do not think ZN need more users. it needs better content management systems first. For example zerotalk is absolutely basic without any important features like like search, admin management etc (described on its github page/s).
zeronet has TONS of unfixed issues

yes, i also have alot of content i would like to share, but i do not have enough storage space as the disk space usage would double (zeronet copy the data i "upload" to its folder - "[ZeroNet uploaded files means duplicity on a HDD](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1515669115_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/ZeroNet+uploaded+files+means+duplicity+on+a+HDD)"). Another problem is that kopykate, ifs, kxovid are not yet enough good developed CMS. what if its development will never continue and new site appear? i will want to add same data to this new site causing triple dulicity? I think i need to first solve my storage: [Cheap device that accept multiple USB HDDs and turn them into one volume connectable to the computer?](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1550331862_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Cheap+device+that+accept+multiple+USB+HDDs+and+turn+them+into+one+volume+connectable+to+the+computer)
